Sentencas: Low-temperature solid oxide fuel cell (SOFC, 300-600 degrees C) technology fueled by methanol possessing significant importance and application in polygenerations has been developed.
Titulo: Development of methanol-fueled low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Thermodynamic analysis of methanol gas-phase compositions and carbon formation indicates that direct operation on methanol between 450 and 600 degrees C may result in significant carbon deposition.
Titulo: Development of methanol-fueled low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: A water steam/methanol ratio of 1/1 can completely suppress carbon formation in the same time enrich H-2 production composition.
Titulo: Development of methanol-fueled low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: Fuel cells were fabricated using ceria-carbonate composite electrolytes and examined at 450-600 degrees C.
Titulo: Development of methanol-fueled low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: The maximum power density of 603 and 431 mW cm(-2) was achieved at 600 and 500 degrees C, respectively, using water steam/methanol with the ratio of 1/1 and ambient air as fuel and oxidant.
Titulo: Development of methanol-fueled low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells

Sentencas: These results provide great potential for development of the direct methanol low-temperature SOFC for polygenerations.
Titulo: Development of methanol-fueled low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells
Development of methanol-fueled low-temperature solid oxide fuel cells
